intro: Delissea lydgatei, commonly known as the Lydgate's delissea, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
